dismissalText.long: c Gulbadin Naib b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Gulbadin Naib b Mohammad Nabi 86 (113b 7x4 0x6 159m) SR: 76.1

dismissalComment.html: Slog sweep is taken in the deep It was a good length ball on off, Litton lunged forward and tried to slog it over cow corner. The top edge ballooned and was in the air for a bit, the fielder came in from long on and dove well to take it.

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Azmatullah Omarzai 30 (36b 3x4 0x6 55m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: Massive wicket, against the run of play! Soft, soft dismissal there, Shakib is clearly disappointed. Omarzai is hurrying on the batters in this over, and this wicket is a result of that. On a length, Shakib looks to steer it away to third man. But ends up playing it on to the stumps. Just the opening Afghanistan would have wanted.

headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalComment.html: Outside edged is snaffled by the keeper. The break in play works for the visitors. It was full outside off, looked to have turned away slightly and taken the outside edge. Rahim tried to defend it with a slightly open faced bat but it tickled off the edge

Taken at slip It was a good length ball. The batter looked in two minds as he stayed in the crease and tried to fend it to the off side. It took the outside edge, hit the keeper's pad and deflected to the right of the slip fielder who took it well to his right

dismissalComment.html: Given LBW It was a good length ball around off, looked to have beaten the bat in front front of the pad and hit him just above the knee-roll. Bangladesh review No contact with the bat detected. Hawk-Eye says the impact was umpire's call and was hitting the stumps. The review is not lost but the decision remains out

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Fazalhaq Farooqi 11 (25b 1x4 0x6 45m) SR: 44

dismissalComment.html: Three in three for Farooqi versus Tamim this series! And this time, there is no front pad for the ball to strike in front of the stumps. Speared full into the stumps, Tamim looks to work it to the on side after getting forward. Leaves a gap between bat and pad for the ball to sneak in and rattle the stumps. A just reward for the bowler.

Mehidy took off right off the bat but the run was not on. The non striker sent him back but was too late.

commentPreTextItems.html: Last powerplay starts. Final formalities left. Miraz has the ball.

commentTextItems.html: Quite an anti-climatic end! Afghanistan win by seven wickets with over nine overs to spare. Gurbaz taps the tossed up ball around middle towards square leg and gets to the other end. Shakib nails the direct hit at the bowler's end but the centurion was well in.

commentPostTextItems.html: 6:33pm That brings curtains to this three-match ODI series. Afghanistan have jumped to the fourth spot on the points table in the ICC World Cup Super League with 70 points. Bangladesh continue to sit pretty at the top with 100 points. The tour's not over yet. The first of the two T20Is will be played on Thursday (March 3) in Mirpur. Be sure to join us then. Hope you have enjoyed our coverage so far. Meanwhile, do check out the coverage for the Women's World Cup that kicks off from this Friday. Until next time, this is S. Sudarshanan signing off, on behalf of Ekanth and Thilak Rama. Take care, stay safe!

Afghanistan captain Hashmatullah Shahidi says he is proud of the team in the way they won the game after winning the first two. Reckons that the pitch was grassy and he was happy with Tamim's choice of batting first. Says that Farooqi's bowling is a big plus, and also praises Gurbaz and Riaz Hassan too. "I love the way they bowled today," he says about Rashid Khan and Mohammad Nabi, the senior pros.

Player of the series, Litton Das Finished with 223 runs in the three games; the next best was 133 (Rahmat Shah.) "I did my job in the first 15 overs since they bowled well in the first powerplay. My target is to bat at least for 35 overs and if I can bat for longer, it will change the game." Thanks his wife for her support, too.

Player of the match, Rahmanullah Gurbaz "I had some icing and recovered from the injury in the previous match. My captain wants hundreds from me and not just fifty. I tried to play a longer knock whenever I get set. Today was my day and I hit a hundred. Rahmat and Riaz played well and once they performed well, I was under pressure since I didn't play well in the first few games. Rahmat supported me well."

Bangladesh captain Tamim Iqbal "Very disappointed. During the ODI championship, we were in a similar position against Sri Lanka and couldn't finish it. Happened again. We started well and lost the rhythm in the middle. Litton Das got out at the wrong time. I probably thought this was the most important game in the series as it is about gaining as many points as possible. We were 100 for one, did the hard-work but lost the wickets when the wicket got better." Talks about not holding on to the chances offered by Gurbaz, before praising him.
Raiyan Lodien: "That's the game we wanted to play, Rahmanullah Gurbaz is the one man army of Afghanistan, wish he would keep the momentum on."
Seth: "What a great young talent Gurbaz is! 3 centuries in his first 9 matches!"

Shakib Al Hasan kept the lid on the scoring at the start, after coming into the attack pretty early. But apart from Riaz Hassan's wicket, the allrounder had little to show for his efforts. At times it did feel as if Bangladesh had thrown in the towel after being bundled out for just 192. Litton Das yet again shone with the bat with an 86-run knock. But there was little to show for Bangladesh apart from him, as Rashid Khan and Mohammad Nabi showed their full wares. A win that should please Afghanistan right before the start of the two-T20I series.

6:08pm A consolation win for Afghanistan, but a very strong one, thanks to a wonderful knock by Rahmanullah Gurbaz, who struck his third ODI ton. Every time he has crossed fifty in the format, he has gone on to cross triple figures. He wasn't without fortune by his side but made it count to finish unbeaten. Gurbaz's 79-run stand for the opening wicket with Riaz Hassan set the chase up wonderfully for the tourists before Gurbaz and Rahmat Shah put the game to bed with their 100-run alliance.

commentTextItems.html: Full on off again, driven to wide mid-off. Allowing Gurbaz to finish the match?

commentTextItems.html: Very full on off, driven back to the bowler again.
Low full toss outside off, pushed towards covers.
Slower through the air outside off, Gurbaz opens his bat-face and guides it to deep point for one.
Flighted full outside off, driven straight to covers. A misfield allows them a single.

commentPreTextItems.html: Yasir Ali to bowl now. Offspinner.
Khurrath: ""What an inning from Gurbaaz? He needs to carry his form for T20 also."

commentTextItems.html: Tossed up full on off, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot.
What a ball! Slower ball attempted from Mustafizur. It was on a shorter length. Gurbaz thinks about leaving it before adjusting late and pulling it over midwicket for a four. A wry smile follows.

commentTextItems.html: Short ball again, Gurbaz hope and keeps it down to the off side.
Back of the hand slower ball, well outside the tramline. Gurbaz lets it be.
Back of a length, angling away. Gurbaz gets on his toes and keeps it down.
Fuller on middle, pushed off the inner half down the ground.
Short ball on middle and leg, Gurbaz misses the pull.

commentPreTextItems.html: Sulaiman Sargar: "So, Afghanistan played well in the series, but a miracle (from 46/6 to 2015/6) took the series from Afghanistan. "

commentTextItems.html: There's the century! No. 3 for Rahmanullah Gurbaz in ODIs. No half-century to show, if I may add. He pushes this full ball through covers for a couple to get to the landmark in 103 balls. How well has he batted today. Well played, young man.
Full and slower through the air on off, Najib blocks again. A wicket-maiden from Miraz.

commentTextItems.html: Tossed up full on off, defended off the front foot.

commentPreTextItems.html: Najibullah Zadran. Three more balls left in the over...

commentTextItems.html: Sharp spin, Najibullah goes back and misses the cut. It was tossed up and well outside off.

dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi lbw b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 2 (7b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 28.57

commentPreTextItems.html: Shahidi's turn now to opt for DRS. He has been ruled out LBW...

commentTextItems.html: Miraz didn't have to appeal for long before getting the umpire's nod this time. Flatter, arm delivery on a length around middle. Shahidi gets down to play the sweep but misses. The ball strikes him low on the back thigh. Three reds and Hashmatullah has to walk.

commentPreTextItems.html: Have the review, use it! Bangladesh opt for one against Hashmatullah for LBW...

commentTextItems.html: Huge appeal! Turned down. Hashmatullah charges down to the tossed up ball to block. But keeps his bat beside the front pad and the ball hits him on the pad. Umpire's call on impact, since Shahidi had come down the track. The Afghanistan captain stays and so does Bangladesh's review.
Arm ball angling in, Hashmat gets his bat down hurriedly to slap it towards backward point.

dismissalComment.html: Three in three for Farooqi versus Tamim this series! And this time, there is no front pad for the ball to strike in front of the stumps. Speared full into the stumps, Tamim looks to work it to the on side after getting forward. Leaves a gap between bat and pad for the ball to sneak in and rattle the stumps. A just reward for the bowler.

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Azmatullah Omarzai 30 (36b 3x4 0x6 55m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: Massive wicket, against the run of play! Soft, soft dismissal there, Shakib is clearly disappointed. Omarzai is hurrying on the batters in this over, and this wicket is a result of that. On a length, Shakib looks to steer it away to third man. But ends up playing it on to the stumps. Just the opening Afghanistan would have wanted.

Mehidy took off right off the bat but the run was not on. The non striker sent him back but was too late.

dismissalComment.html: Out, stumped It turned away and the batter was out of the crease when Rahim first looked to take off the bails. He didn't and tried again. Riaz was not able to stride back inside the crease and will have to depart. Not sure if Riaz had lost balance or could not skid back his toes.
